questions.text: A 60-year-old male patient comes to OPD with lipodystrophy. On taking drug history, he said that he is taking drugs for his HIV infection and the drugs are zidovudine, lamivudine, and lopinavir/Ritonavir. Which of the following drug is used in the treatment of his lipodystrophy?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Tesamorelin Tesamorelin is used for the treatment of HIV-associated lipodystrophy.

Highyeild:

Tesamorelin A modified form of human GHRH Resistant to degradation by dipeptidyl peptidase 4 Has a prolonged duration of action Able to increase the levels of GH and IGF-1 FDA-approved for the treatment of HIV-associated lipodystrophy but not for GH deficiency.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Somatostatin is a GH inhibitory hormone, can be used in Acromegaly, Option: B. Goserelin- is a LH blocker.Goserelin implant is used in combination with radiation therapy and other medications to treat localized prostate cancer and is used alone to treat the symptoms associated with advanced prostate cancer. Option: C. Testosterone- has no role in HIV lipodystrophy . Because, In HIV-associated lipodystrophy, there are already marked elevations of total serum testosterone in the range reserved for androgen-producing tumors.

questions.text: A 60-year-old male patient comes to OPD with low back pain and difficulty during micturition. His PSA levels are 100 ng/ml. which of the following drug is used in treatment?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Goserelin Male patient with low back pain and difficulty during micturition . His PSA levels are 100 ng/ml , the case history points towards prostate cancer . The drug used for treatment is GnRH agonists like Goserelin by continuous administration. Continuous administration of GnRH agonists down-regulates GnRH receptors in the pituitary gland. This suppresses the release of the gonadotropins -FSH and LH from the During the transient rise in LH , the resultant testosterone surge may induce acute stimulation of prostate cancer growth and a “flare” of symptoms from metastatic deposits . Patients may experience an increase in bone pain, spinal cord compression , or obstructive bladder symptoms lasting for 2–3 weeks. The flare phenomenon can be effectively counteracted with concurrent administration of 2–4 weeks of oral antiandrogen therapy, which may inhibit the action of the increased serum testosterone levels.

Highyeild:

GnRH (Gonadotropin releasing hormone) .. GHRH Agonist with Intermittent Administration GnRH Agonist with Continues Administration ● Anovulatory infertility ● Oligozoospermia - Infertility (hypogonadotrophic hypogonadism) ● Delayed puberty ● Cryptorchidism ● Precocious puberty ● CA of prostate ● Endometriosis ● Premenopausal breast cancer ● Uterine fibroids Disadvantage- Flare-up in cancers initially. GnRH agonists GnRH antagonists BUSERELIN (nasal) GOSERELIN LEUPROLIDE NAFERELIN (nasal route) TRIPTORELIN DESOLORELIN HISTARELIN Decrease in FSH & LH decrease in Estrogen & Testosterone Adv: No flare up of tumor • ABARELIX •GANIRELIX • CETRORELIX • DEGARELIX • ELAGOLIX-To decrease pain in Endometriosis

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Somatostatin - Somatostatin is GH inhibitory hormone, and its analog is Octreotide , which can be used in Acromegaly, Option: C.Testosterone increases prostate cancer , so avoided in this patient Option: D. Tesamorelin -a modified form of human GHRH, FDA-approved for the treatment of HIV-associated lipodystrophy but not for GH deficiency.

Extraedge:

Prostate Cancer Treatment Medical treatment- Complete ANdrogen Blockade Antiandrogens: i)Androgen receptor blockers- antagonize androgen action on prostate carcinoma cells and have palliative effects in a dvanced/metastatic cases. Because they increase androgen secretion by antagonizing androgenic action in the pituitary, combination with orchiectomy or GnRH analogs is required to produce a full therapeutic effect. Flutamide Also used in Acne Hirsutism Bicalutamide Nilutamide ADR-Decreased adaptation to light at night time. ii)Cyproterone acetate GnRH agonists- Goserelin They indirectly inhibit estrogen/androgen secretion by suppressing FSH and LH release from the pituitary and have a palliative effect in advanced estrogen/androgen-dependent carcinoma of the breast and prostate. They are generally used in combination with antiandrogens or SERMs. ADR- when used continuously causes To avoid Androgen receptor blockers are used. E.g. , Leuprolide FDA-approved gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) agonist used for the management of Endometriosis Uterine leiomyomata Central precocious puberty in children Advanced prostate cancer. Inhibition of Androgen synthesis Ketoconazole Aminoglutethimide Abiraterone Immunotherapy Surgical management

questions.text: A female was given a higher dose of methyl ergometrine for postpartum hemorrhage and continued after that for several days. Mother had very little milk secretion for 1 month. The reason for this is-

options.label: A
options.text: Partial agonistic action of methyl ergometrine on 5-ht2 receptors

options.label: B
options.text: Partial agonistic action of methyl ergometrine on ? adrenergic receptors

options.label: C
options.text: Agonistic action of methyl ergometrine on dopamine receptors

questions.correct_answer: C. Agonistic action of methyl ergometrine on dopamine receptors
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Agonistic action of methyl ergometrine on dopamine receptors As dopamine is a Prolactin release inhibitor. The dopamine agonist action of methyl ergometrine when used in higher doses is responsible for little milk secretion in the mother.

Highyeild:

Dopamine agonists are used in- Treatment of hyperprolactinemia Reduction in size of prolactinomas Parkinson's disease Acromegaly Type 2 DM (Bromocriptine)

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Partial agonistic action of methyl ergometrine on 5-ht2 receptors - is used in the treatment of migraine. Option: B. Partial agonistic action of methyl ergometrine on α adrenergic receptors- causes vasospasm and gangrene as a side effect. Option: D. is incorrect.

questions.text: Pegvisomant is used in the treatment of-
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Acromegaly Pegvisomant is a Growth Hormone Receptor antagonist. Approved for the treatment of It binds to the GHR but does not activate JAK-STAT signaling or stimulate IGF-1 secretion.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: A, C, and D. Are not the indication for the use of pegvisomant.

questions.text: Which of the following is an Oxytocic drug?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Carbetocin Is an Oxytocic/Uterine stimulant drug.

Highyeild:

UTERINE RELAXANTS & STIMULANTS TOCOLYIC UTERINE RELAXANTS UTERINE STIMULANTS • USED in Preterm delivery • Used in Threatened abortion when doing obstetric procedure/maneuvers → Are used before delivery to induce delivery →→ During delivery to increase uterine contraction → After delivery to prevent PPH B2 agonist- RITODRINE ISOXSUPRINE SALBUTAMOL TERBUTALINE * OXYTOCIN→ contract the upper segment & relax the lower segment CARBETOCIN DESAMINO-OXYTOCIN Ergots: PPH (ERGOMETRINE & METHYLERGOMETRINE) NB: For induction of labour, Erygometrine not used • Ca channel blocker - NIFEDIPINE • Oxytocin receptor antagonist - ATOSIBAN • PG Synthetase inhibitor - ASPIRIN & INDOMETHACIN • MAGNESIUM SULFATE A. It contract upper & Lower segment & baby can't come out easily B. It cause sustained contraction in contrast to oxytocin which cause contraction & relaxation .. preferred is oxytocin https:// 2 Coupon code: RHE20 • Prostaglandin MISOPROSTOL DINOPROSTONE DINOPROST CARBOPROST

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: A, C, and D. are tocolytic/uterine relaxant drugs.

questions.text: For a term pregnant lady, an Oxytocin drip was started for induction of labor. Which of the following is not a side effect of Oxytocin given to this patient?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Gangrene of toe Gangrene of the toe may be seen with Ergometrine used in PPH, not Oxytocin.

Highyeild:

Side effects of oxytocin- Water intoxication During labor - Fetal distress Fetal death too rapid delivery- uterine and cervical rupture

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: A, B, and C. Oxytocin can cause these adverse effects.

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Type 1 DM Type 1 DM-Dopamine agonists are not useful in Type 1 DM.

Highyeild:

Dopamine agonists are used in- Treatment of hyperprolactinemia Reduction in size of prolactinomas Parkinson's disease Acromegaly Type 2 DM (Bromocriptine)

questions.text: All the following drugs cause hyperprolactinemia except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Cabergoline Cabergoline - is a dopamine ag onist .Which causes Hypoprolactinemia by decreasing the release of Prolactin.

Highyeild:

Drugs causing Hyperprolactinemia (Usually dopamine agonists)- Dopamine Bromocriptine Cabergoline quinagolide Drugs causing Hyperprolactinemia (Usually dopamine antagonists)- Chlorpromazine Risperidone Haloperidol Methyldopa Metoclopramide

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options A, B, and D. can cause hyperprolactinemia.

questions.text: Dopamine agonists are contraindicated in all of the following conditions except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

History of migraine Ergots are used in migraine because of their vasoconstriction property, so that is not a contraindication.

Highyeild:

Dopamine agonist/PIH(Prolactin release Inhibitory Hormone)- PIH (Dopamine) D2 agonists - Bromocriptine, Cabergoline (ergots) [E- Ergots F - Fibrosis G - Gangrene] Prolactinoma Hyperprolactinemia Galactorrhoea Infertility Parkinson's Acromegaly Contraindications of Dopamine agonists History of psychosis In psychosis, D2 blockers are given not Dopamine agonists Recent myocardial infarction because ergots may cause vasospasm and increase risk. peripheral vascular disease as ergots may cause vasospasm and gangrene.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A, B, and C . are contraindications for the use of Dopamine agonist/PIH(Prolactin release Inhibitory Hormone)

questions.text: Which of the following GnRH Agonists can be given by nasal spray?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Nafarelin Nafarelin is a long-acting GnRH agonist that is 150 times more potent than native GnRH. It is used as an intranasal spray from which bioavailability is only 4–5%.

Highyeild:

GnRH (Gonadotropin releasing hormone) .. questions.text: Which of the following is the drug of choice for precocious puberty?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

GnRH analog GnRH analogs- are DOC for precocious puberty. but they need to be given continuously to suppress the release of FSH, and LH and thereby decrease estrogen and progesterone in females and testosterone in males.

Highyeild:

GnRH (Gonadotropin releasing hormone) .. GHRH Agonist with Intermittent Administration GnRH Agonist with Continues Administration ● Anovulatory infertility ● Oligozoospermia - Infertility (hypogonadotrophic hypogonadism) ● Delayed puberty ● Cryptorchidism ● Precocious puberty ● CA of prostate ● Endometriosis ● Premenopausal breast cancer ● Uterine fibroids Disadvantage- Flare up in cancers initially. Cyproterone acetate-progesterone drug and Weak antiandrogen used as an oral contraceptive and for Hirsutism (off label). Option: D. Medroxyprogesterone acetate- synthetic progesterone, used as Depot preparation for contraception. questions.text: Which of the following is a selective estrogen receptor down-regulator (SERD)?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Fulvestrant Fulvestrant is a ‘selective estrogen receptor down-regulation (SERD).

Highyeild:

Fulvestrant- It is the first member of a distinct class of estrogen receptor ligands called ‘selective estrogen receptor down-regulators’ (SERDs) or ‘pure estrogen antagonists’ Fast onset of action and long duration of action used for the treatment of metastatic ER-positive breast cancer in postmenopausal women which has stopped responding to tamoxifen.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Tamoxifen and Raloxifene- Are selective estrogen receptor modulators. Option: B. Clomiphene is an antiestrogen.
